intro: Carelia satureiifolia, commonly known as the satureiifolia or the lesser satureia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires a cool, moist climate to flourish. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
